metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Psalm 130: The Depth of Sin and the Radiance of Love

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the historical context of Paul's 'agonized' letter to Corinth and the liturgical history of Psalm 130, focusing on the 'miserable offender' language.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong focus on the emotional weight of the Greek text and the liturgical shifts in the Book of Common Prayer.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from describing Paul's desperation (Assertive) to inviting the hearer to recall their own experiences of love (Expressive/Directive) and finally pronouncing the blessing (Declarative).
voorbeelden: I may leave you today with renewed confidence
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all
Think about those people who have borne with you

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should feel the weight of their 'miserable' state but find relief in the 'plenteous redemption' of God.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; the Spirit is mentioned as a member of the Trinity and in the benediction, but not explicitly as the agent of the sermon's efficacy.

voorbeelden: The Corinthian church has gone completely off the rails
This is the movement of Psalm 130
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
Think of the people who have loved you
I may leave you today with renewed confidence
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities
The love that is with us even into the last ditch
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from Scripture rather than formulated as direct 'I promise you' from the preacher.

voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all
I leave you today... invoking the apostolic blessing
declaratieven.autoriteit: High; utilizes the liturgical authority of the Trinitarian benediction to close the speech act.

indicatoren: Lengthy explanation of the 1976 Prayer Book changes
Describing Paul's emotional state in the third person
Explaining the 'fear of the Lord' as a concept
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer learns a great deal about theology and liturgy but may remain an observer of the 'event' rather than a participant.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise ('God promises YOU today')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of distance; God is 'the Someone' rather than 'the One speaking to me now'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Scriptural and liturgical, but slightly indirect.
voorbeelden: He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used to build rapport ('we') and to frame the preacher's exit ('I leave you').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used primarily in the 'Imagine' and 'Reflect' sections.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to trigger memory and imagination rather than to deliver the promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode; talking about Paul, the Corinthians, the Psalmist, and 'the people'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the middle sections.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical exegesis of Paul and the Prayer Book.

actueel_present.gebruik: The closing benediction and the 'now' of the congregation.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (God is love) to the Commissive (He will redeem) via the Declarative (Benediction).
voorbeelden: The movement from the 'depths' of Psalm 130 to the 'plenteous redemption' offered at the end.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but buried under significant constative weight.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because there is forgiveness (Indicative), therefore he shall be feared (Imperative/Response).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is deeply rooted in the Gospel of grace and aims to comfort, but it functions more as a 'testimony about' grace than a 'sacramental mediation' of it until the very end.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The analogy of the parent with the self-destructing child.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates immediate pathos and situational relevance.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The section on the 1976 Prayer Book deletion.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Interrupts the illocutionary flow with academic/historical critique.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an 'event' in the final paragraph where the preacher explicitly 'invokes' the blessing, shifting from talking about the blessing to performing it.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher relies heavily on the 'hint' of human love rather than the 'Word' as a creative force.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as the one who 'pursues,' but the preacher rarely lets God speak in the first person.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a guide/teacher more than a herald.
tekstueel_bewijs: I may leave you today... invoking...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the 'blessing' as the means of grace more than the 'proclamation' itself.
tekstueel_bewijs: Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance of God’s love.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (Assertives). It needs more 'I [God] promise' or 'I [Preacher] declare'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: With the Lord there is mercy.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Because you are in Christ, the Lord has mercy on YOU right now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth (Constative) to a personal address (Performative).

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often framed as a 'discovery' the psalmist made rather than a gift given to the hearer.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the second person 'you' more aggressively in the final third.
voorbeeldzinnen: Today, God promises to redeem you from your depths.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent in the 3rd person (Paul, the Psalmist).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Collapse the distance between the biblical character and the hearer.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like the Psalmist, you are standing in the depths; and like the Psalmist, you are forgiven.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good; the indicatives are strong.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'fear of the Lord' is not just explained but called for.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply moving and orthodox sermon that successfully bridges human experience and divine love, though it occasionally retreats into the role of a lecture on liturgical history.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the closing blessing isn't just 'information' (Sender) but a 'reality-changing act' (Declarative).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: While rhetorically strong in its analogies, the SAT analysis shows the power lies in the 'Commissives'—God's binding himself to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event-character' is concentrated almost entirely in the final 10% of the text.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: This is the peak performative moment where the sermon 'happens'.

appendices.notities: The preacher's use of 'miserable offenders' provides a strong 'illocutionary hook' for the subsequent word of grace.
